citations.narrative:
* There is a mixture of dirt, grease and other excreta accumulating on the interior metal divider, entryway metal doors
and the fiberglass wall board in two enclosures. Four dogs are in contact with the affected surfaces located in shelter
housing. The affected area covers approximately 20 to 30 percent of the exterior wall area. Cleaning of surfaces is
necessary to prevent an accumulation of excreta and other disease hazards. This indicates an unsanitary living condition
exists that could lead to potential disease or health risks. Surfaces which are not cleaned and sanitized properly increase
the risk of disease hazards for the dogs. Cleanliness is important to the health and well-being of the animals. All surfaces
of housing facilities must be cleaned and sanitized when necessary to satisfy generally accepted husbandry standards
and practices. The licensee must ensure that hard surfaces with which the dogs come in contact must be spot cleaned
daily and sanitized in accordance with 3.11 (B) of this sub part to prevent accumulation of excreta and reduce disease
hazards. Correct by 6/6/23.

* An accumulation of fecal and other organic material was accumulating on the north outside ground area next to south
sheltered building. Ten dogs are in contact with the affected area. Fecal and organic material can attract pests and
rodents, become a disease hazard or area of contamination to the animals. Odors, insects, disease hazards, and pest
infestation from fecal and organic material accumulations can have an adverse effect on the health and well-being of the
animals at this facility. The licensee must have provisions in place for the removal and disposal of animals and food
wastes, bedding, dead animals, trash and debris. Correct by 6/15/23.

* There was no recorded date for annual heartworm testing on 60 dogs. Annual heartworm testing is important for the
health of the animals. I did verify with the veterinarian of record and no heartworm tests had been completed. Heartworm
testing is done to ensure that there are no active internal parasites. Heartworms are serious parasites that are
transmitted by insect bites. The licensee must ensure that all dogs are receiving vaccinations for contagious and/or
deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, parvovirus, and distemper) and sampling and treatment of parasites and other
pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending
veterinarian. Correct by 7/1/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
*    There is a mixture of dirt, grease and other excreta accumulating on the interior metal divider, entryway metal doors 
and the fiberglass wall board in two enclosures. Four dogs are in contact with the affected surfaces located in shelter 
housing. The affected area covers approximately 20 to 30 percent of the exterior wall area. Cleaning of surfaces is 
necessary to prevent an accumulation of excreta and other disease hazards.  This indicates an unsanitary living condition 
exists that could lead to potential disease or health risks.  Surfaces which are not cleaned and sanitized properly increase 
the risk of disease hazards for the dogs. Cleanliness is important to the health and well-being of the animals. All surfaces 
of housing facilities must be cleaned and sanitized when necessary to satisfy generally accepted husbandry standards 
and practices.   The licensee must ensure that hard surfaces with which the dogs come in contact must be spot cleaned 
daily and sanitized in accordance with 3.11 (B) of this sub part to prevent accumulation of excreta and reduce disease 
hazards.  Correct by 6/6/23. 
3.1(f) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
*    An accumulation of fecal and other organic material was accumulating on the north outside ground area next to south 
sheltered building.  Ten dogs are in contact with the affected area.   Fecal and organic material can attract pests and 
rodents, become a disease hazard or area of contamination to the animals.  Odors, insects, disease hazards, and pest

infestation from fecal and organic material accumulations can have an adverse effect on the health and well-being of the 
animals at this facility.  The licensee must have provisions in place for the removal and disposal of animals and food 
wastes, bedding, dead animals, trash and debris.  Correct by 6/15/23. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
*   There was no recorded date for annual heartworm testing on 60 dogs.   Annual  heartworm testing is important for the 
health of the animals.  I did verify with the veterinarian of record and no heartworm tests had been completed. Heartworm 
testing is done to ensure that there are no active internal parasites.   Heartworms are serious parasites that are 
transmitted by insect bites.  The licensee must ensure that all dogs are receiving vaccinations for contagious and/or 
deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, parvovirus, and distemper) and sampling and treatment of parasites and other 
pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending 
veterinarian.  Correct by 7/1/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
